questions.question: How did these features affect New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina?

choices.answer: Tornadoes gained momentum in open land areas.
Storm surges caused a massive shift in tectonic plates.
Mud slides trapped residents in the city.
Storm waters flooded the city after several levees broke.

questions.question: Under the Family and Medical Leave Act an employee can be guaranteed time off

choices.answer: to complete a college degree.
to care for a newborn child.
for an extended vacation due to airline delays.
for assignment to a different work location.

questions.question: The creator of this political cartoon was expressing his concerns about

choices.answer: the confirmation hearings of nominee Clarence Thomas
U.S. declaring war on Japan after bombing of Pearl Harbor
the expansion of executive power during the Great Depression
the involvement of U.S. officials in the Iran-Contra scandal

questions.question: This organization most likely encourages Congress to pass legislation that

choices.answer: finances oil exploration in domestic waters
focuses on finding clean and renewable energy sources
reduces regulation of the coal-mining industry
gives substantial tax breaks to natural-gas companies

questions.question: Which  best describes a major impact Bill Gates has had on U.S. business and technology?

choices.answer: set up the first computer network systems for the military.
designed the heat-shield technology used on space shuttles.
started the company that makes computer software
created an online store to purchase consumer goods.

questions.question: What was a primary purpose of the program being promoted by this poster?

choices.answer: To encourage women to join the workforce
To reduce health problems among working women
To promote the purchase of organically grown produce
To increase the food supply during a farm-labor shortage

questions.question: Which situation demonstrates one way that U.S. culture has spread to other parts of the world?

choices.answer: A teenage girl buys a hip-hop CD in China.
A young boy in Great Britain watches anime
A businesswoman eats at a sushi restaurant in Canada.
A college athlete in Brazil trains for the Olympics.

questions.question: The political activism of the group described in the excerpt contributed directly to

choices.answer: the elimination of poll taxes
the repeal of the 18th Amendment
the outlawing of child labor
the ratification of the 19th Amendment

questions.question: The Roaring Twenties were characterized by

choices.answer: internment camps, the rationing of goods, and atomic bombs
bank failures, the New Deal, and bread lines
installment plans, Prohibition, and flappers
brinkmanship, McCarthyism, and a policy of containment

questions.question: How did the military innovation shown in this photograph affect the course of World War I?

choices.answer: It helped break the stalemate of trench warfare.
It transported large numbers of troops to the battlefield.
It made the use of land mines obsolete.
It made communications with officers  possible.

questions.question: What is unique about Sandra Day O’Connor?

choices.answer: She was the first African American Supreme Court Justice
She was the first woman Supreme Court Justice
She was the first Hispanic Supreme Court Justice
None of the above

questions.question: This excerpt illustrates Harding’s campaign promise to be a president who would

choices.answer: help the country recover from turmoil of the previous decade
refuse to allow the continuation of laissez-faire policies
use diplomacy to establish alliances with other countries
improve economic growth by allowing unrestricted immigration

questions.question: Which of the following was a major contribution of the Harlem Renaissance to U.S. culture?

choices.answer: It led to the popularity of vaudeville stage performers
It brought the most significant beat poets together.
It established jazz as a prominent musical form.
It focused attention on the antiwar literary genre

questions.question: How did Pres. Harry Truman’s decision to drop the atomic bomb affect international relations?

choices.answer: It initiated the arms race with the Soviet Union.
It prompted nations to begin investigations of war crimes
It enabled the UN to administer territory in Japan
It led to the establishment of the global peacekeeping force

questions.question: Which  explains why worldwide reactions to U.S. involvement in Vietnam grew hostile?

choices.answer: The US was viewed as appeasing a brutal dictator.
The US demanded the unconditional surrender of Ho Chi Minh
The US was as an aggressor invading an underdeveloped nation
The US  ignored a UN Security Council resolution

questions.question: Which of the following occurred as a result of the Sherman Antitrust Act?

choices.answer: Workers secured a greater share of company profits
The influence of labor unions on factory owners was reduced
The federal government could dissolve business monopolies
Businesses were forced to pay fees to open oversea locations

questions.question: What role did Arkansas governor Orval Faubus play in the Little Rock Crisis?

choices.answer: He authorized legislation to end segregation in schools
He challenged the federal government to desegregate schools
He helped minimize race-related violence
He wanted to improve minority graduation rates.

questions.question: Cartoons such as this one took the position that deportation was necessary because

choices.answer: assimilation programs in the USA had been unsuccessful
economic decline had increased the competition for jobs
communists were infiltrating the United States
political machines had too much power in urban areas

questions.question: Which pull factor contributed to the Great Migration?

choices.answer: The availability of land grants for homesteaders
Economic opportunities in industrialized cities
Better soil conditions in previously uncultivated areas
The lower cost of living in urban areas

questions.question: Why did the Populist Party want free coinage of silver?

choices.answer: To increase the amount of money in circulation
To reduce economic inflation
To raise campaign contribution limits
To decrease the bargaining power of labor unions

questions.question: How did the Booker T. Washington work to improve the lives of African Americans?

choices.answer: By hosting voter registration drives for African Americans
By supporting  labor unions  for African Americans
By promoting vocational training for African Americans
By demanding equal rights immediately for African Americans

questions.question: What influenced the U.S.-Soviet signing of the SALT I treaty in 1972 was President Nixon’s

choices.answer: opening of diplomatic relations with China
involvement in the Watergate scandal
support of Israel during the Yom Kippur War
withdrawal of military forces from Vietnam

questions.question: Which of these contributed to the ratification of the Eighteenth Amendment?

choices.answer: Veteran soldiers protesting to obtain benefits
The growing political influence of women
Politicians campaigning for education reform
The growing number of workers organizing into labor unions

questions.question: Nineteenth-century nativist organizations advocated

choices.answer: limiting military power through the organization of militias
conserving natural resources through national parks
globalizing the economy through participation in free-trade
promoting an homogeneous society by restricting immigration

questions.question: What was one reason for the expansion of machine politics in the late nineteenth century?

choices.answer: Too many immigrants for local governments to support
Restrictions prevented voters from influencing government
The economy was too tightly regulated to allow urban growth
Settlement houses failed to help immigrants adjust to life

questions.question: What is one ongoing result of the New Deal?

choices.answer: The federal government funds a space-exploration program
State governments deny residency to workers in other states
State governments use property taxes to fund social security
People rely more on the federal government

questions.question: The ideas contained in the Declaration of Independence helped

choices.answer: motivate European rulers to establish new colonies
inspire people to question the authority of their government
encourage new settlers to assimilate native populations
get religious leaders in other countries to stop persecution

questions.question: Which of the following resulted from the U.S. involvement  in the Persian Gulf War?

choices.answer: The Shah of Iran was overthrown
The nation of Kuwait was liberated
Saddam Hussein was forced from power
Iraqi Kurds were granted equal rights

questions.question: The creation of initiative, referendum, and recall  during the Progressive Era resulted in

choices.answer: a system of separate schools for new immigrants
a redistribution of the tax burden among citizens
expansion of citizen participation in the democratic process
more sources of revenue for state governments

questions.question: Vernon Baker was awarded the Medal of Honor. How was this award historically significant?

choices.answer: He led the brigade to land at Normandy during World War II.
African American veteran of World War II awarded the medal
only recipient to serve in both World War I and World War II
the first U.S. naval officer to be honored for bravery

questions.question: The Twenty-second Amendment was passed in response to which event?

choices.answer: The election of Franklin Roosevelt to 4th presidential term
Herbert Hoover’s reelection defeat
Bill Clinton’s impeachment trial
The resignation of Richard Nixon after Watergate

questions.question: Which of the following was a defining characteristic of the United States during the 1930s?

choices.answer: sharp increase in the power given to state governments
An extended period of economic depression
The adoption of an interventionist foreign policy
The formation of a national Civil Rights movement

questions.question: One way the Internet has improved the quality of life in the United States is by

choices.answer: decreasing the influence of advertising on consumers
increasing the reliability of available information
improving privacy protection for individuals
increasing the ease of obtaining information

questions.question: Which civic action demonstrates the most fundamental responsibility of citizens in a democracy?

choices.answer: Volunteering at a community food bank
Signing a petition on a college campus
Registering with the Selective Service
Voting in a presidential election

questions.question: How were  Navajo words used during World War II?

choices.answer: As propaganda to improve morale among Allied soldiers
As a secret code for communicating between Allied units
As signal words for Allied spies posing as civilians
As a language of diplomacy for exchanges with enemy forces
